questions.question: What is the main difference between Present Perfect Simple and Continuous?
choices: The Simple form focuses on the result, while the Continuous form emphasizes the duration
The Simple form is used for ongoing actions, while the Continuous form is for completed actions
The Simple form is only used with regular verbs, while the Continuous form is used with irregular verbs
There is no difference; they are interchangeable
questions.answer: The Simple form focuses on the result, while the Continuous form emphasizes the duration
